member.name: T:DbExtensions.AffectedRecordsPolicy
member.summary: Indicates how to validate the affected records value returned by a non-query command.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.AffectedRecordsPolicy.MustMatchAffecting
member.summary: The affected records value must be equal as the affecting records value.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.AffectedRecordsPolicy.AllowLower
member.summary: The affected records value must be equal or lower than the affecting records value.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.AffectedRecordsPolicy.AllowAny
member.summary: The affected records value is ignored.

member.name: T:DbExtensions.ConcurrencyConflictPolicy
member.summary: Indicates what concurrency conflict policy to use. A concurrency conflict ocurrs when trying to UPDATE/DELETE a row that has a newer version, or when trying to UPDATE/DELETE a row that no longer exists.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.ConcurrencyConflictPolicy.UseVersion
member.summary: Include version column check in the UPDATE/DELETE statement predicate.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.ConcurrencyConflictPolicy.IgnoreVersion
member.summary: The predicate for the UPDATE/DELETE statement should not contain any version column checks to avoid version conflicts. Note that a conflict can still ocurr if the row no longer exists.

member.name: F:DbExtensions.ConcurrencyConflictPolicy.IgnoreVersionAndLowerAffectedRecords
member.summary: The predicate for the UPDATE/DELETE statement should not contain any version column checks to avoid version conflicts. If the number of affected records is lower than expected then it is presumed that the row was previously deleted.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.EnableBatchCommands
member.summary: true to execute batch commands when possible; otherwise, false. The default is true. You can override the default value using a "DbExtensions:{providerInvariantName}:EnableBatchCommands" entry in the appSettings configuration section, where {providerInvariantName} is replaced with the provider invariant name (e.g. DbExtensions:System.Data.SqlClient:EnableBatchCommands).

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.EnableInsertRecursion
member.summary: true to recursively execute INSERT commands for the entity's one-to-one and one-to-many associations; otherwise, false. The default is true.

member.name: P:DbExtensions.DatabaseConfiguration.LastInsertIdCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL command that returns the last identity value generated on the database. The default value is "SELECT @@identity". You can override the default value using a "DbExtensions:{providerInvariantName}:LastInsertIdCommand" entry in the appSettings configuration section, where {providerInvariantName} is replaced with the provider invariant name (e.g. DbExtensions:System.Data.SqlClient:LastInsertIdCommand).
